title: Online Collaboration-Based Language Instructional Design Professional Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge in the field (basic grammar understanding, text analysis skills) and practical language teaching experience
context.additional_context: A project-based learning environment for enhancing expertise in language education for current practitioners, featuring online collaboration via BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) and a personalized feedback system to improve reading comprehension and expression skills.

learning_goals: Participants can share and discuss practical knowledge related to language instructional design (e.g., text analysis, vocabulary utilization strategies) with peer teachers and experts via an online collaboration platform.

Participants can complete one instructional design project in language education, submit a final output (e.g., integrated reading-writing activity design) after incorporating at least three rounds of expert feedback, and achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least four out of five rubric criteria.
Participants can apply various language teaching strategies (e.g., context-based vocabulary learning, communication-focused activities) to actual classes to enhance student engagement.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Zoom, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
